text: He is here and she is here.

text: Capital cities are big and noisy.
We only work for five days.
I was at the cinema yesterday.

text: How long will you be staying?
Shall we see each other tomorrow?
I am sorry, but I already have plans.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the snow? White.

text: What do you like to read?

translate: Viņa runā ne vien vācu, bet arī franču valodā.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: Es neprotu spēlēt ne klavieres, ne ģitāru.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: Es neprotu dejot ne valsi, ne sambu.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: Man nepatīk ne opera, ne balets.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: Jo ātrāk tu strādāsi, jo ātrāk tu pabeigsi.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: Jo agrāk tu atnāksi, jo agrāk tu varēsi iet.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
The button from the shirt is gone.
The boss’ computer is not working.
How do I get to her parents’ house?
translate: Kā es varu nokļūt līdz viņas vecāku mājām?

text: The house is at the end of the road.
What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
What are the doctor’s consultation times?
What time is the museum open?
Since when is she no longer working?
translate: Kopš kura laika viņa vairs nestrādā?

text: Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
translate: Jā, viņa vairs nestrādā, kopš ir precējusies.

text: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
translate: Kopš viņa ir precējusies, viņa vairs nestrādā.

text: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
translate: Kopš viņi pazīst viens otru, viņi ir laimīgi.

text: Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: Kopš viņiem ir bērni, viņi reti kaut kur iziet.
Jā, kad viņa brauc ar mašīnu.
Viņa runā pa telefonu, kad brauc ar mašīnu.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
She listens to music while she does her work.
translate: Viņa klausās mūziku, kad pilda uzdevumus.

text: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: Es neko neredzu, ja man nav briļļu.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: Es neko nesaprotu, ja mūzika ir tik skaļa.

text: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: Es neko nesaožu, ja man ir iesnas.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: Mēs ņemsim taksometru, ja līs lietus.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: Mēs apceļosim pasauli, ja laimēsim loterijā.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: Mēs sāksim ēst, ja viņa drīz nebūs klāt.

text: Are you already allowed to drive?
translate: Vai tu jau drīksti braukt ar mašīnu?

text: Are you already allowed to drink alcohol?
translate: Vai tu jau drīksti lietot alkoholu?

text: Are you already allowed to travel abroad alone?
translate: Vai tu jau drīksti viens pats braukt uz ārzemēm?

text: May one pay by credit card?
May one pay by cheque / check (am.)?
May one only pay in cash?
translate: Vai drīkst maksāt tikai skaidrā naudā?

text: May I just make a call?
He is not allowed to sleep in the park.
He is not allowed to sleep in the car.
He is not allowed to sleep at the train station.
I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
I become tired as soon as I have to study.
translate: Es jūtos nogurusi, līdzko man jāsāk mācīties.

text: I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
translate: Es pārtraukšu strādāt, līdzko man būs 60.

text: As soon as I have a moment.
He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
translate: Viņš piezvanīs, līdzko viņam būs nedaudz laika.

text: I’ll work as long as I can.
I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
translate: Es strādāšu, kamēr vien būšu vesela.

text: He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: Viņš guļ gultā tā vietā, lai strādātu.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
translate: Viņa lasa avīzi tā vietā, lai gatavotu ēst.

text: He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: Viņš sēž krodziņā tā vietā, lai ietu mājās.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
translate: Cik es zinu, viņš dzīvo šeit.

text: As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: Cik es zinu, viņa sieva ir slima.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
translate: Cik es zinu, viņš ir bez darba.

text: I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Es aizgulējos, citādi es būtu bijusi laikā.

text: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Es nokavēju autobusu, citādi es būtu bijusi laikā.

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Es neatradu pareizo ceļu, citādi es būtu bijusi laikā.
